description: An ancient city of Lower Mesopotamia, Puzriš-Dagan was founded in the twenty-first century B.C. by King Shulgi of Ur.

history.comment: wikipedia see further, not see also
New locations, names, and places for the Ancient Near East from the Alexandria Archive Institute's GANE project: http://alexandriaarchive.org/projects/gane/.

locations.details: Centre point location extracted from polygon drawn around entire site as identified on Google Earth base imagery in QGIS 3.x.

references.formattedCitation: Bryce, Trevor. The Routledge Handbook of the Peoples and Places of Ancient Western Asia: The Near East from the Early Bronze Age to the Fall of the Persian Empire. London; New York: Routledge, 2012. https://doi.org/10.4324/9780203875506.
Sallaberger, Walther. “Puzriš-Dagān.” In Reallexikon Der Assyriologie Und Vorderasiatischen Archäologie, 11:125–28. Berlin & New York: Walter de Gruyter, 2008 2006.
